00068 /* Control values that are put in the TREDescription data_type field */
00069 enum
00070 {
00071     NITF_LOOP = NITF_BINARY + 1,    
00072     NITF_ENDLOOP,                   
00073     NITF_IF,                        
00074     NITF_ENDIF,                     
00075     NITF_COMP_LEN,                  
00076     NITF_END                        
00077 };
00078 
00079 /* This can be used if the user wants to loop a constant number of times */
00080 /* Set the TREDescription label to NITF_CONST_N, and the number in the tag */
00081 /* Example: {NITF_LOOP, 0, NITF_CONST_N, "4096"} */
00082 #define NITF_CONST_N    "CONSTANT"          
00083 #define NITF_FUNCTION   "FUNCTION"

00087 struct _nitf_TREHandler;
00092 typedef struct _nitf_TRE
00093 {
00094         struct _nitf_TREHandler* handler;  
00095         NITF_DATA* priv;                   
00096     char tag[NITF_MAX_TAG + 1];        /* the TRE tag */
00097 } nitf_TRE;

00244 
00255 typedef struct _nitf_TREHandler
00256 {
00257     /* The init method gets called when creating a TRE from scratch */
00258     NITF_TRE_INIT init;
00259 
00260     /* Get the name/id of the TRE. This is NOT the tag, however it may be the
00261      * same value as the tag. The id is used to identify a specific
00262      * version/incarnation of the TRE, if multiple are possible. For most TREs,
00263      * this value will be the same as the tag.
00264      */
00265     NITF_TRE_ID_GET getID;
00266 
00267     /* The read method gets called when reading a TRE from an IO interface */
00268     NITF_TRE_READER read;
00269 
00270     /* setField is called by the setField proxy of the TRE API */
00271     NITF_TRE_FIELD_SET setField;
00272 
00273     /* getField is called by the getField proxy of the TRE API */
00274     NITF_TRE_FIELD_GET getField;
00275 
00276     /* find is called by the find proxy of the TRE API */
00277     NITF_TRE_FIND find;
00278 
00279     /* write gets called when writing the TRE to an output IO interface */
00280     NITF_TRE_WRITER write;
00281 
00282     /* begin is called by the begin proxy of the TRE API */
00283     NITF_TRE_ITERATOR begin;
00284 
00285     /* getCurrentSize is called by the getCurrentSize proxy of the TRE API */
00286     NITF_TRE_SIZE getCurrentSize;
00287 
00288     /* clone is called when a TRE is cloned */
00289     NITF_TRE_CLONE clone;
00290 
00291     /*
00292      * destruct is called when a TRE is destroyed - NOT when the handler is.
00293      * destruct is an optional operation and doesn't need to be provided by
00294      * plug-in implementations
00295      */
00296     NITF_TRE_DESTRUCT destruct;
00297 
00298     /* optional data that contains handler-wide data for supporting TREs of
00299      * the type that the plug-in handles
00300      */
00301     NITF_DATA* data;
00302 } nitf_TREHandler;
